summary: What Is a Last Will and Testament. A last will and testament is a legal document that defines where your property, like money and personal items, will go after your death.

Kangaroo (English kangaroo - from the Kuuku-Yimithiri language of the Australian aborigines gangurru "gray kangaroo", Latin Macropus (literally: "big leg")) is the commonly used name for a group of animals from the order of two-incisor marsupial mammals. In a broad sense, the term "kangaroo" refers to all members of the kangaroo family - especially the red-footed kangaroo, antelope kangaroo, eastern gray (giant) kangaroo and western gray kangaroo.

“Užička Republic” (Serbo-Croatian Uzhička republika / Užička republika) is the conventional name of the territory of Western Serbia and Šumadija, liberated from German occupation and Quisling power, west of the Belgrade-Kraljevo-Novi Pazar line, which was under the control of the Yugoslavs during the Second World War in the period from September 24 to November 29, 1941 Partisans and Chetniks.

Murder on the Orient Express is a detective novel by English writer Agatha Christie, written in 1933 in Iraq, where she was on an archaeological expedition with her second husband Max Mullowan. It is one of the most famous works of the novelist, a vivid example of the novels of her so-called “Oriental cycle”.

A fictitious person is an individual specially selected to perform any transaction in order to hide the identity of the true beneficiary. In the legislation of most countries, the use of dummies (“nominalities”) in the economy is acceptable as long as the purpose of their use is not to evade the beneficiary from liability.

Kindness is a type of behavior characterized by acts of generosity, consideration, assistance, or concern without expecting praise or reward in return. It is a subject of interest in philosophy, religion and psychology.
“Duel in the Taiga” is a Soviet adventure feature film produced at the film studio named after. Gorky in 1977 by directors Vladimir Zlatoustovsky and Ivan Lukinsky.

A fekete város (The Black City, or The Black Town) is a Hungarian novel of Kálmán Mikszáth set in the town of Lőcse, today Levoča. It is based on real historical events, but the story and dialogue are fictional.
"Don't Go Away" is a song by English rock band Oasis from their third album, Be Here Now (1997). Written by Noel Gallagher, the song was released to radio in the U.

“The Sorrows of Young Werther” (German: Die Leiden des jungen Werthers - in the first editions and German: Die Leiden des jungen Werther - in modern ones) is a sentimental novel in the letters of Johann Wolfgang Goethe in 1774. The novel reflects the dramatic personal experiences of the hero against the background of German reality.

“The Hunchback” (English: The Adventure of the Crooked Man) is a story by English writer Arthur Conan Doyle about the famous detective Sherlock Holmes. Part of the collection "The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes", published in 1893.

“Hotel “At the Dead Mountaineer”” (full title: “The Murder Case, or Hotel “At the Dead Mountaineer” (another departure from the detective genre)”) is a story by the Strugatsky brothers in the genre of fantastic detective, written in 1969. Rally is a type of auto racing that takes place on open or closed tracks using modified or specially built cars. This type of racing is different in that the races are mainly laid out on public roads, in the format “from point A to point B” with passing checkpoints.
“The Moment Decides Everything” is a Soviet feature film directed by Viktor Sadovsky, filmed at the Lenfilm studio in 1978. The premiere took place in July 1979.
Declaration of Love” is a Soviet two-part feature film-melodrama directed by Ilya Averbakh based on the book “Four Quarters” by Yevgeny Gabrilovich. Production of the Lenfilm film studio, 1977
“Moscow Doesn’t Believe in Tears” is a Soviet melodramatic film directed by Vladimir Menshov. The premiere took place at the end of 1979 at the Moscow Zvezdny cinema.
“Siberiada” is a Soviet color (with inserted black and white fragments) four-part epic feature film directed by Andrei Konchalovsky. In 1979 he was awarded the Grand Prix at the Cannes Film Festival.

Interrogation is an investigative and judicial procedure in which information is obtained from the person being interrogated that is known to him and falls within the definition of the subject of proof. Interrogation can only be carried out in accordance with current legislation within the framework of tax, criminal and civil (arbitration) processes.
“Emergency Train” is a Soviet historical and biographical feature film filmed by director Vladimir Shevchenko at the Film Studio. The film takes place in 1922 after the end of the Russian Civil War.

Toʻylar muborak/Tylar muborak) is a Soviet feature film directed by Eduard Khachaturov. The film was created at the Uzbekfilm film studio in 1978.

Somewhere far away there is a war going on, but even here, deep in the rear, in a small foothill village, the war has entered every home with widowhood, orphanhood, backbreaking labor and deprivation. But grief and worries did not isolate or embitter people.

Triptych (from ancient Greek τρί-πτυχος “consisting of three tablets” ← τριάς “three” + πτῠχή “tablet, tablet”) is a work of art consisting of three parts: bas-reliefs, paintings, icons (folding), statues and others, combined general idea. The work is divided into three sections or three carved panels, which are placed side by side.

Crime investigation is the activity of specially authorized state bodies to obtain information about an action or inaction that has signs of a crime, to establish the event and elements of the crime, to expose those responsible for its commission, to take measures to compensate for the damage caused by the crime, to identify the causes and conditions that contributed to the commission of the crime. In Roman law, judicial proceedings were divided into two sections: preliminary proceedings (in iure), which replaced the modern preliminary investigation and trial, and final proceedings (in iudicio).

Shore is a narrow strip of interaction between land and a body of water (sea, lake, reservoir) or between land and a watercourse (river, temporary channel stream). A comet (from ancient Greek κομήτης, komḗtēs - “hairy”, “shaggy”) is a small celestial body revolving around the Sun in a very elongated orbit in the form of a line of conical section. As the comet approaches the Sun, it forms a coma and sometimes a tail of gas and dust.

Fire is an uncontrolled combustion process, a strong flame that engulfs and destroys everything that can burn. The combustion process is an integral part of a fire, but combustion itself leads to a fire only in exceptional cases.

A fable or non-fiction is a genre of oral folk art, a prose or poetic narrative of a small volume, usually of comic content, the plot of which is based on an image of a deliberately distorted reality. According to the definition of philologist-folklorist V.
Spartak Molodtsov (Leonid Kuravlev) is a man who cannot pass by. Because of this, he constantly ends up in different stories.

San Sanych Lyubomudrov is an energetic and in his own way talented business person who can come to an agreement with everyone, establish the necessary connections and get hold of the deficit. His talent is the ability to make friends.

Leadership, in psychology, is a process of social influence through which a leader receives support from other members of the community to achieve a goal. The explanation of leadership is reflected in several theories: situational, functional, behavioral and others, as well as the integral theory of leadership.
Morning of the Doomed Mine is a Soviet film produced by the Mosfilm studio in 1985. The film is based on the novel “Inspector of the Golden Taiga” by Buryat writer Vladimir Mitypov.

Kidnapping is an unlawful intentional action aimed at secretly or openly, or through deception, capturing a person, removing him from his natural microsocial environment, moving him from his place of residence, followed by holding him against his will in another place. For the most part, it is committed for selfish reasons and has the goal of obtaining a ransom from relatives or people close to the kidnapped person, as well as forcing these persons to perform actions necessary for the kidnappers.
“The Fairies' Autumn Gift” is a Soviet fairy tale film based on the fairy tale “Galoshes of Happiness” by Hans Christian Andersen. Filmed at the Belarusfilm studio in 1984.

Landing is the final stage of the flight of an aircraft (aircraft), during which the aircraft slows down from a height of 50 feet (15 meters) above the end of the runway until the aircraft comes to a complete stop on the runway. A rough landing of an aircraft (with increased overload) can lead to its destruction and disaster (death of the crew and passengers).

Gunpowder is a multicomponent solid “explosive” (not a blasting substance) mixture capable of regular combustion in parallel layers, without access to oxygen from the outside, with the release of large amounts of thermal energy and gaseous products used for throwing projectiles, propelling rockets and for other purposes. The history of the emergence and development of the production and use of energy materials capable of relatively rapid energy release through various chemical reactions is voluminous, ambiguous and largely contradictory

Heavy burden is a common expression that refers to both physical and emotional heaviness. This phrase is often used in a figurative sense to describe difficult life circumstances, problems or responsibilities.

A snake catcher, or snake catcher, is a person who is engaged in catching snakes in the wild, mostly poisonous ones, for the selection of their poison or their subsequent keeping in captivity, as a rule, in serpentariums, including for repeated selection of poison. Professional snake catchers usually work in large serpentariums.
“Valentin and Valentina” is a Soviet melodramatic film directed by Georgy Natanson based on the play of the same name by Mikhail Roshchin. Tatiana Doronina's last film role to date.

Bernard Coudray is an exemplary family man, living in the suburbs of Grenoble with his loving, beautiful wife Arletta and his young son. Their orderly provincial life goes on as usual, until one fateful day Philippe and Matilda Bochard move into the house next door.
The End of Operation Resident” is a Soviet two-part feature film produced at the Central Film Studio of Children's and Youth named after M. Gorky in 1986 by director Veniamin Dorman
Under Fire is a film directed by Roger Spottiswoode, released in 1983. The film is based on the life of journalist Bill Stewart, who was killed in 1979 by the Nicaraguan National Guard

Erich Kästner is a wonderful writer. His books, for children and adults, are known and popular all over the world.

Adultery, or adultery (French adultère, Latin adulter - dissolute) is the betrayal of one spouse to the other. Obsolete synonyms (usually in the context of religion or canon law): adultery, fornication, also tricks.

Lampyridae) are a family of beetles, a characteristic feature of which is the presence of special luminescent organs - lanterns. Lanterns are located on the last abdominal segments, most often under the transparent cuticle, and are formed by large photogenic cells, which are abundantly intertwined with trachea and nerves.

Panthera onca) is a species of predatory mammal of the cat family, one of five representatives of the genus Panthera (Panthera), which belongs to the subfamily of big cats. The only representative of the genus in North and South America.

A children's playground is an area where elements of children's outdoor play equipment are located for the purpose of organizing meaningful leisure time. Play equipment, in turn, is a set of structural structures that promote physical and mental development, taking into account individual characteristics and while having a beneficial effect on the social adaptation of the child
“Time of Sons” is a Soviet color feature film filmed by director Evgeny Matveev at the Mosfilm studio in 1986. Screen adaptation of Joseph Gerasimov’s novel “The Gap in the Calendar.

Trizna is a set of pagan funeral rites among the Eastern Slavs or part of them, consisting of songs, dances, feasts and military competitions in honor of the deceased. The funeral feast was performed near the burial site after the burning of the deceased.

Madness, insanity (also obsolete insanity) is a severe mental disorder. Until the end of the 19th century, madness or insanity was considered behavior or thinking that went beyond the accepted social norm, such as painful convulsions, hallucinations while remaining fully conscious, strange or self-destructive actions, and suicide attempts.

Twilight is the time interval during which the Sun is below the horizon, and natural illumination on Earth is provided by the scattering of sunlight in the atmosphere and the residual luminescent glow of the atmosphere itself caused by ionizing radiation from the Sun. Twilight at any latitude below the Arctic Circle, depending on the definition of night, can be considered either as part of the night, or as part of the day between night and day.

Conversation is a form of interactive, spontaneous communication between two or more people. Typically, conversation occurs in verbal communication, while written communication is not usually considered conversation.

Sacrifice is a form of religious cult, a magical rite performed in order to appease supernatural forces, to receive help, protection, health and other benefits from them, or in gratitude for the fulfillment of any request. Exists to one degree or another in most religions.
“Escape” (French: La Carapate) is a film, a light French sitcom with Pierre Richard and Victor Lanou in the lead roles. The premiere in France took place on October 11, 1978.
“The Runaways” (French Les Fugitifs) is a film, a sitcom. The final of three classic comedies with the comic duo Richard - Depardieu (“The Unlucky Ones,” “Dads,” “The Runaways”).

Shock (from the French choc - blow, push) is a pathological process that develops in response to the influence of extreme stimuli and is accompanied by a progressive disruption of the vital functions of the nervous, respiratory systems, circulatory system, metabolism and some other functions, the pathomechanism of which is based on a violation of hemodynamics, primarily microcirculation, with the development of tissue hypoxia. In essence, this is a breakdown of neurohumoral regulation and compensatory reactions of the body in response to extreme damage, with a further critical deterioration of the adaptation syndrome under stress.

1959 There is a polio epidemic in Japan, from which thousands of children die or become disabled. The Salk vaccine, used in Japan, is only effective in 60% of cases, and there is not enough of it for everyone in need.

Angel's Day is the day of human baptism; This is also sometimes symbolically called name day. Name day is sometimes called Angel's Day because in the old days heavenly patrons were sometimes called Angels of their earthly namesakes; However, one must not confuse saints (people (holy souls)) with Guardian Angels sent to care for and protect people.

Our Father), also the Lord's Prayer (Κυριακὴ προσευχή; Oratio Dominica; Mltva gdⷭ) is a prayer in Christianity. According to the Gospel, Jesus Christ gave it to his disciples in response to a request to teach them prayer.
